product.text:
Brer Rabbit and His Friends

Based on the 1946 epic Disney film Song of the South, this imaginative tale recounts the adventures of Brer Rabbit, Brer Fox, and Brer Bear, as told from one of the most legendary storytellers of all time, Uncle Remus. Clever Brer Rabbit outwits Brer Fox and Brer Bear and returns to the safety of the briar patch to help Johnny, a plantation child, cope with his confusion over his parents’ separation. This poignant tale shows kids that running away from your troubles is not the answer.

Tie-In Activity: Using characters from the story as inspiration, help your child develop her own adventure in which Brer Rabbit outwits Brer Fox and Brer Bear. Use pictures (her own drawings or magazine clippings) to depict her story, and then have her reenact it.
